definition: to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to pay/to hand over to/classifier for pairs or sets of things
to handle matters with ease (idiom)/to hold one's own
handling any occasion smoothly (idiom); equal to any situation
to struggle to cope (with a situation)/to be at one's wits' end
hard to deal with/hard to handle

sentences.english: Nana pulled an all-nighter to study for her math exam.
sentences.chinese: 爲了應付數學考試，娜娜學了一個通宵。

sentences.english: He can cope with the present situation.
sentences.chinese: 他能夠應付當前的局勢。

sentences.english: The social worker had to deal with the poor family's mistrust of strangers.
sentences.chinese: 該社工人員必須應付這戶窮苦人家對陌生人的不信任。

sentences.english: He dealed with an embarrassed situation dexterously.
sentences.chinese: 他很巧妙地應付了一個尷尬局面。

sentences.english: I know my own strength, and I shall never be embarrassed again by his coming.
sentences.chinese: 這次我既然能夠應付，等他下次再來，我便不會發窘。

sentences.english: Those variants equip an organism specially well to cope with the exigencies of the environments.
sentences.chinese: 變異使生物體配備得特別完善以應付環境的嚴酷要求。

sentences.english: The society was not even in funds to pay its out of pocket disbursements.
sentences.chinese: 該社團甚至沒有經費應付日常開支。

sentences.english: I had to make do with my old PC last week.
sentences.chinese: 上週我只能用那臺舊電腦來應付。

sentences.english: He's boning up for his finals.
sentences.chinese: 他爲應付期末考試而臨陣磨槍。

sentences.english: It's all about damage containment here.
sentences.chinese: 這裏應付的都是損害性的打擊。

sentences.english: The nature of modest from your personality will enable you easily get over of troubles.
sentences.chinese: 踏實穩重的性格讓你在遇到困難時也能沉着應付。

sentences.english: Bonds payable are the typical example of long-term liabilities.
sentences.chinese: 應付債券是長期負債的典型例子。

sentences.english: I guess I’m a one-big-project-at-a-time kind of guy.
sentences.chinese: 我想我是那種一段時間只能應付一個目標的人。

sentences.english: Mr. Katsav denied the allegations and took a leave of absence to fight the charges.
sentences.chinese: 卡察夫否認這些指控，並暫時離職以應付這場官司。

sentences.english: I can deal with it. I can handle it.
KN :Well, you've seen the order quantities. What do you think you could manage?
sentences.chinese: 你已看到了定貨量，你認爲你能應付什麼情況？

definition: to handle/to treat/to deal with/to process/to deal with a criminal case/to mete out punishment/to offer for sale at a reduced price/to punish
to settle (a dispute)/to resolve/to solve/to dispose of/to dispatch
expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
